name: SchemeFlow
headline: Automating Government Approvals for Construction Projects
description:
SchemeFlow uses AI to automate government approvals for construction projects.

Two brothers + high school friend, with great combo of skills: Mayor’s Chief of Staff, Arup construction engineer + AI software engineer.

Using LLMs to generate reports in minutes rather than months, and to scrape + parse complex local regulations.

Already generated over 10,000 pages of technical reports for over 400 construction projects, from car parks to hotels, housing to office buildings, with 97% time savings.

Started in the UK with 10x paid pilots with engineering companies such as Stantec and Royal Haskoning, now pivoted to focus on the US.

$9B US opportunity (143k consultants x $64k/yr report-writing work), $23B worldwide.

www.schemeflow.com
tags: industry:documents; industry:generative-ai; industry:govtech; industry:construction; industry:proptech; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Andrew Browning, CEO & Co-Founder

founders.name: Jonny Browning, Founder

founders.description:
COO & Co-Founder of SchemeFlow.
Automating Government Approvals for Construction Projects.

University of Cambridge Engineering - First Class.

generated_description:
**SchemeFlow: Revolutionizing Construction Project Approvals**

Founded in 2023 and part of Y Combinator's Batch S24, SchemeFlow is on a mission to streamline the often convoluted process of gaining government approvals for construction projects. At its core, SchemeFlow harnesses the power of AI to drastically cut down the time it takes to generate the necessary technical reports—reducing what once required months to mere minutes.

The company was born from the partnership of two brothers and a high school friend, each bringing a unique skill set: a Mayor’s Chief of Staff skilled in navigating bureaucracy, a construction engineer from Arup, and an AI software engineer. This trifecta combines industry knowledge with technical prowess, forming the ideal team to tackle the complexities of construction regulations.

Using advanced Large Language Models (LLMs), SchemeFlow has already accomplished the impressive feat of generating over 10,000 pages of report documentation for more than 400 projects—including car parks, hotels, and office buildings. The resulting time savings are staggering: up to 97%. This efficiency is attractive not just for construction firms, but for the consultants who aid them.

Initially launched in the UK, SchemeFlow quickly pivoted to target the U.S. market, where there’s a staggering $9 billion opportunity. There are approximately 143,000 consultants currently involved in report writing, which SchemeFlow can significantly benefit, or there’s an even larger $23 billion potential on a global scale.

Located in San Francisco with a compact team of four, SchemeFlow is making waves in the domains of generative AI, government technology (govtech), and proptech. They’re currently engaged in automating the drafting of crucial technical reports for various sectors such as transportation, environment, and economic development.

With a clear focus and ambitious plans, SchemeFlow stands ready to transform the landscape of construction project approvals. If you’re interested in learning more, you can visit their website at [www.schemeflow.com](https://www.schemeflow.com). With key partners like Tom Blomfield and a passion for impactful technology, keep an eye on SchemeFlow—they're poised to change the game.
